title: Forum for the Comparative Study of Jews and Muslims in Britain, Europe and North America
abstractText:
These workshops break new ground by creating a forum in which comparative studies of Jews and Muslims can be explored as a means to achieve an improved understanding of contemporary Muslim-Jewish relations. 
There has been no comparative research on this field despite the urgent need for data in view of contentious claims made by some within each faith-group regarding the historical record and current behaviour of the other. By bringing scholars, students and practitioners of the Jewish and Muslim experience together, current comparative research can be presented and the possibilities for future studies explored.
